instructions: sc, dc inc, dc, dc inc, sc
wings.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

comb.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

Grogu.name: Baby Yoda / Grogu

bodyRobe.instructions_start: ch 15, connect to form a ring
finishing: sc around in FLO of row 8.

instructions: Row 1: sc across, flip and ch 1 (2 sts)

ears.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to head.

rounds.instruction: switch to brown; sc in each st around

notes: Insert eyes between rows 7 and 8 of the head, spaced 6 stitches apart.
Only sew the scarf where it overlaps.
Left ear: first stitch around rows 9 and 10 of the head.
Right ear: first stitch around rows 8 and 9; sew upward.

bulb.finishing: Finish off. Sew in a '+' shape, wrapping the yarn tail around the bulb and tightening to create bumps.

body.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

ears.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to head.

legs.finishing: Finish off with sc, sl-st, and leave a long tail to sew to body.

rounds.instruction: Flatten and work through both sides (10 spaces): [sc, hdc, sc, sl-st, (sc, hdc), (sc, hdc), sl-st, sc, hdc, sc]

wings.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

ears.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to head.

BaldEagle.name: Bald Eagle

rounds.instruction: BLO sc in each st around (switch to brown)

tail.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

beak.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to head.

wings.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

notes: Eyes: row 8 stitch 7, and row 8 stitch 13/14 — each eye 2 stitches away from the beak.
Tail: top sewn between rows 14 and 15, bottom between rows 16 and 17.
Beak: top sewn between rows 5 and 6, bottom between rows 8 and 9.
Wings: sew horizontally around row 11, about 7 stitches away from the center beak line.

Pig.name: Pig

rounds.instruction: BLO sc in each st around

snout.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to face.

tail.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to back.

ears.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to head.

feet.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

notes: Eyes: placed between rows 3 and 4, 8 stitches apart on row 3, 9 stitches apart on row 4.
Snout covers rows 1 and 2 of the face.
Tail attaches around row 16.

Otter.name: Otter

rounds.instruction: switch to darker brown; sc in each st around

tail.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

limbs.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

notes: Eyes placed between rows 7 and 8.
Ears positioned between rows 4–6.
Face centered between rows 7–9.
Arms attached between rows 10–13.
Legs attached between rows 16–19.
Tail attached between rows 18–20.
Arms and legs spaced 5 stitches apart.
Eyes spaced approximately 6–7 stitches apart (6 visible stitches, or about 5.5 apart).

Sheep.name: Sheep

rounds.instruction: switch to white in sl-st, ch 1; [2 sc, inc] x 6, flip
sc in each st around, flip
sc in each st around, flip

instructions: (ch 2, dc, ch 2, sl-st) in one stitch

feet.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

notes: Bobble stitch: 3 dc in the same stitch.
Bobble rows are worked on the wrong side.
Use a 4.00 mm hook for bobble rows and a 3.50 mm hook for normal rows.

Pug.name: Pug

instructions: Row 1: sc 2, (sc 4), sl-st around the bottom, (inc, sc), sl-st
snout.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to face.

instructions: Row 1: sc, 2 hdc, sl-st to head (3 sts)
Row 1: hdc, ch 1 (no sl-st), tie ends together

notes: Refer to personal video taken Jan 8, 2024, for exact placement of facial features, ears, and feet.
Add more specific placement notes later.

KoyaBt21.name: Koya (BT21)

finishing: On second leg, ch 2 to begin joining for body.

rounds.instruction: sc into leg 1, 8 sc around, sc in ch-2 spaces, 9 sc around leg 2, sc in ch-2 spaces

body.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

instructions: Row 1: sc, inc, inc on other side, inc, sl-st
Row 1: inc, sc, inc, inc on other side, sc, inc
Row 2: inc, 3 sc, 2 inc, 3 sc, inc

notes: Sew nose 1 stitch between rows 6 and 11 of the head.
Sew white pieces onto the edges of ears and stomach.
Sew ears starting on row 4 and continuing into half rows up to row 8.
Arms are sewn to row 12 of the body.

ChimmyBt21.name: Chimmy (BT21)

head.notes: Work with tighter tension so the head fits inside the hood.

body.notes: Body is identical to Koya's body pattern.
body.instructions_reference: Use the body instructions from Koya (BT21).

ears.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to head.

rounds.instruction: switch to yellow; sc in each st around

arms.finishing: Finish off with long tail to sew to body.

notes: Head should be made with tighter tension so it fits inside the hood.
Body is identical to the Koya BT21 body pattern.
Sew ears onto the sides of the hood after attaching the head.
Arms are sewn to the body after the hood is positioned.
